data.summary: "Lovin On Me" is a song by American rapper Jack Harlow, released as a single on November 10, 2023, through Generation Now and Atlantic Records. It was written by Harlow, Oz, Sean Momberger, Nik Frascona, Nickie Jon Pabón, and Reginald Nelton. Produced by Oz, Frascona, and Momberger, the song samples the 1995 R&B track "Whatever (Bass Soliloquy)" by Cadillac Dale. Prior to its release, a snippet of the song went viral on TikTok. The single's music video was released the same day. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "Cruel Summer" is about a tumultuous relationship between two people, set against a summer backdrop. The lyrics tell the story of someone who is desperately in love, who has to sneak away from their protective family to be with their love, and how that love is both exhilarating and painful. Despite the feeling of uncertainty and potential hurt, the singer is hopeful that their love will conquer even the most difficult odds and that their relationship will survive. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "greedy" is a song by Canadian singer-songwriter Tate McRae. It was first teased on August 4, 2023, before being officially released on September 15, 2023. It is the lead single from her second studio album, THINK LATER. It was written by McRae, Ryan Tedder, Amy Allen, and Jasper Harris and produced by Tedder and Harris. It also notably samples Nelly Furtado's 2006 track, "Promiscuous". McRae describes the song as "a new chapter of my music". “I wrote ‘Greedy’ about having the confidence to know what you want Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "Paint the Town Red" is a song by Doja Cat. The song was released on August 4, 2023, via Kemosabe Records and RCA as the second single (first radio single) from her fourth studio album, Scarlet. The song samples Dionne Warwick's "Walk On By" and is a departure from the Pop/Rap sound of Doja's previous projects; Hot Pink & Planet Her. It was released after Doja's controversy with her fans and tabloids. It addresses some comments about her personality, career and choices as an artist and person, using her alter-ego “Scarlet” to do Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "Snooze" is about how special the person she's with is and how she can't bear to lose him. Despite his sometimes questionable habits and decisions, she still loves and appreciates him and their relationship. She sings of their connection and emphasizes her loyalty and willingness to ride with him "till the wheels come off". The song encourages listeners to never take a special moment for granted and to live in the moment with those you love. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "Last Night" is a song recorded by country music singer Morgan Wallen, the third single from his 2023 album One Thing at a Time. The song peaked at #1 on the Billboard Hot Country Songs in February 2023. For the week ending March 18, 2023, "Last Night" reached the top of the Billboard Hot 100, a first for Wallen. It became the first country song to top the chart since "All Too Well (Taylor's Version)" by Taylor Swift in 2021. The last country song by a solo male artist to get the top spot was "I Love a Rainy Night" by Eddie Rabbitt in 1981. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: In “Agora Hills,” Doja Cat evokes the complex feelings of wanting to publicize a love that must be kept private out of necessity, and whatever that necessity may be. Throughout the track, Doja expresses her love, and even mentions her marriage. The track’s title has been floating around for months before being unveiled as the fifth single from Doja’s fourth studio album, Scarlet. It samples Troop’s 1989 hit “All I Do Is Think of You.” Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: “Flowers” is the lead single from Miley Cyrus' eighth studio album Endless Summer Vacation. The song is about her past relationship with ex-husband Liam Hemsworth, releasing the track on his birthday, with lyrics implying she doesn’t need him to fulfill her happiness. Cyrus first teased the new era with cryptic posters around the world that featured lyrics and a release date. Fans were skeptical about it, until she later dropped the first teaser on New Year’s Eve, along with announcing the single’s title and release date. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: On “Stick Season,” singer and songwriter Noah Kahan unlocks the next level of his artistry. The track arrives via Republic Records as an homage to growth, encapsulating the highs and lows of change that – while hard to understand in the moment – are necessary and inevitable in life. “I wrote ‘Stick Season’ without knowing it would become, in my opinion, the most important song of my career,” Kahan shared in a statement. “It allowed me to finally cross over into the style of songwriting that I have loved my entire life Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "Dance the Night" is a song by English and Albanian singer Dua Lipa, released on 25 May 2023 by Atlantic Records as the lead single from Barbie: The Album, the soundtrack album from the film Barbie (2023). It is a disco song that features cello, violin, viola, strings, and bass in its instrumentation, "Dance the Night" is about dancing throughout the night despite enduring sadness. Its music video, which features a cameo from Greta Gerwig, was released alongside it. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: “fukumean” is a high-energy track where Gunna taps into the melodies that initially established him into the modern rap scene. On it, Gunna bounces back from a dark period of his life in good spirits, shown by confident, braggadocios lyrics. As of 2023, it is Gunna’s best performing song on the Billboard Hot 100 following “pushin P” which peaked at #7 on January 22, 2022. Along with that accolade, it is his third top ten hit to date, being at #8 as of charting week July 15 Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "Houdini" is a song by English and Albanian singer Dua Lipa, released on 9 November 2023 as the lead single from her upcoming third studio album. Earlier in 2023, Lipa confirmed that her upcoming third studio album would be released sometime in 2024 with a new sound that sees her moving away from disco, embracing more of 1970s-era psychedelia. After having deleted all of her Instagram posts on 12 October 2023, Dua Lipa posted a picture of herself in red hair captioned "miss me?". Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: “Used To Be Young” is the fourth single off of Miley’s Endless Summer Vacation and was released on August 25th separate from the album. On an excerpt of the Endless Summer Vacation: Continued (Backyard Sessions) special Miley mentioned that the date has a special meaning to her: ‘I decided to release used to be young on August 25th because this particular date historically has been important to me personally and in my career.’ She said. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "Kill Bill" is about the intensity of unresolved feelings in a relationship, particularly when the other person has moved on. The narrator is expressing her frustration, jealousy, and pain from her partner moving on and thus, fantasizes about getting revenge by literally killing them and their new partner. She realizes this isn't a wise plan and is struggling to accept that the relationship may not have been meant to be and has reached a point of no return. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: The song "exes" by Tate McRae explores the complex dynamics of past romantic relationships and the impact they have on the singer. In the pre-chorus, the line "Let's just say, it is what it is and was what it was" suggests that the singer has come to accept the reality of their past relationships, acknowledging that they cannot change what has already happened. The chorus expresses a mix of emotions towards the singer's exes. The repeated phrase "Kisses to my exes" can be seen as a sarcastic or bitter expression Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: In “I KNOW ?,” Travis Scott portrays an image of what life is like for him when he does drugs and drinks alcohol, suggesting he’s tainted and bothered by everyone looking out for him. In the chorus, the heavy repetition of, “I know” suggests that Travis is feeling fed up and bothered by everyone judging him for being on drugs, however, because he’s so addicted, despite people caring for him, he brushes it off as though he feels they’re not looking out for him. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "​get him back!" explores the conflicting emotions and desires that arise after a failed romantic relationship. The lyrics depict a past relationship with a guy who had some negative traits, such as an ego, a temper and a wandering eye. Despite these flaws, the protagonist acknowledges that he was fun to be with and provided exhilarating experiences like parties and outings. The chorus reveals the protagonist's conflicting emotions. On one hand, she wants to make him jealous, make him feel bad, and seek revenge. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "Feather" is a song by American singer Sabrina Carpenter from Emails I Can’t Send Fwd:, the deluxe edition of her fifth studio album released in 2022. Carpenter and Amy Allen wrote the song with its producer, John Ryan. "Feather" is a pop song about overcoming a relationship. Incorporating electric piano, piano, synthesizer, kick, and bass in its instrumentation, the song's lyrics detail blocking someone on social media and feeling like a burden has been lifted after leaving them behind: "I got you blocked / After this Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: On “500lbs,” Lil Tecca flaunts the benefits of his position alongside noting his devotion for his significant other. The track was first previewed on June 2, 2023 through Taz Taylor’s Instagram story. The track later made an official release on July 21, 2023, followed by a Jordie Sanchez-directed music video a week later. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: You're Losing Me is a "From The Vault" track from Midnights by Taylor Swift. It was released on an exclusive Midnights (The Late Night Edition) CD only available at the East Rutherford shows of The Eras Tour on May 26, 2023. The track is written by Swift as well as longtime collaborators Jack Antonoff and Aaron Dessner, and is rumored to be about Swift's recent breakup with Joe Alwyn. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: In “Standing Next to You,” Jung Kook (정국) adopts the grand “us-against-the-world' mentality prevalent in many 2000s pop songs such as Westlife’s “You Raise Me Up” and Beyonce’s “Halo.” These simple yet powerful emotions are laid on top of this dramatic, jazz-funk, disco-pop instrumental that compliments the romantic retro aesthetic of the song. The song’s lyrics express the strong feelings the narrator feels for a loved one from simply standing side-by-side with each other. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "bad idea right?" explores the conflicted emotions and desires that arise when encountering an ex-partner. The song portrays a scenario where the protagonist hasn't heard from their ex in months, but when they receive a call, it ignites a mixture of nostalgia, curiosity and confusion. Geffen Records released it as the album's second single on August 11, 2023. Rodrigo co-wrote the song with its producer, Dan Nigro. It is the second track and single from Olivia Rodrigo's sophomore studio album, GUTS. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: “Virginia Beach”, the introduction of For All The Dogs, is dedicated to the city of the same name located in Virginia, where Drake notably performed at during his 2014 tour alongside Lil Wayne. As For All The Dogs is a testament to Drake’s earlier musical endeavors, “Virginia Beach” is a full-circle moment of his career after over nine years. The instrumental samples Frank Ocean’s “Wiseman”. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: Rich Men North of Richmond highlights the struggles of the working class in America. It was released by Oliver Anthony (@AintGottaDollar) on August 11, 2023, and within 2 days the song had already gone viral and placed 3 of Oliver Anthony’s songs in Apple music’s top 10, though he was previously unknown. This song placed Anthony on the map, so much that legendary country star John Rich offered his assistance to help produce a record. Following the song's usage at the 2023 Republican National Debate Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: “run for the hills” is the third track from Tate McRae’s sophomore album. In the song, Tate talks about the feeling of having a deep desire to always be close to her lover. Similar to the theme of the album, Tate talks about how in the moment she is so deeply in love that her entire world becomes her and her lover. The song was first teased on November 21, 2023, on Tate McRae’s TikTok account. “run for the hills” is one of the first songs we wrote for this record. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: “MY EYES” portrays Travis Scott’s life throughout his POV as he raps about the struggles and obstacles he’s gone through in his life. Throughout the track, Travis makes several notations of the lack of love he feels while contrasting the topics as he boasts his success and affluence. In the first part of the track, assisted by the melancholy and gloomy vocals provided by Sampha, Travis particularly touches on the lack of love in his life despite it being filled with materialistic values which tend to make people happy. Read more on Last.fm.

data.summary: "Murder on the Dancefloor" is a song by English singer Sophie Ellis-Bextor, from her 2001 debut studio album, Read My Lips. The song is reported to have been the most played song in Europe in 2002. It returned to the UK Top 10 in January 2024 following its use in the film Saltburn (2023), becoming Ellis-Bextor's first top 10 single since 2007. Read more on Last.fm.
